column1: Dear Friend,Next week,Congress breaks for its annual summer recess period.
I will begina busy month of traveling around Indianapolis meeting withcommunity members and organizations committed to making our city a safe and enjoyable place to live.
I am looking forward to spending August visiting with hard working Hoosiers and sharing ideas about how we can work together to solve the issues we all face.
Stay tuned to mywebsiteand social media pages to learn more about what I am doing in your neighborhood in the coming weeks.
In addition, I hope you will join me August 6, at Ivy Tech Corporate College and Culinary Center (2820N. Meridian St.)
for my5 thannual job fair .
As always, if there is somethingI can do for you, please call my office and let me know how I can help.

Sincerely,André CarsonInside Scoop:Website Photo ContestThis week, I am inviting residents and visitors of the 7 thCongressional District to capture the beauty and uniqueness of Indianapolis by taking part in an online photo contest.
Winners will have their submitted photo featured on my website for the remainder of the year.
Entries must be sent toindyphoto@mail.house.govby6 p.m.
on August 1 .

For more information, click here:http://carson.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-carson-announces-website-photo-contestICYMI: Recognizing a Local HeroLast week I had the privilege of calling 8-year-old J acen Troxell from my office in Washington, D.C., to thank him for his work in helping to keep our Indianapolis law enforcement officers safe.
He has raised over $13,000 to help cover the cost of updating bulletproof vests for the Indianapolis Metro Police Department.
Thank you, Jacen!
Keep up the good work!

To watch the video, click here:https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=808823409136771&set=vb.123884330964019&type=2&theaterVoting: Our Privilege and ResponsibilityOne of the greatest privileges of being an American citizen is the opportunity to voice your opinion through the electoral process.
